channel.title: ::master -- Command Makes Client Crash
channel.description: Well, whenever I do the ::master command, my client crashes.

item.title: ::master -- Command Makes Client Crash
item.dc:creator: @surfer25 surfer25
item.description:
@surfer25 wrote:

[quote=“X F U R Y X, post:7, topic:155029”]Heres a better way, just use my master command…

		} if(command.equals("master") && playerRights >= 2) {
    			 for(int i = 0; i < 24; i++)
             			addSkillXP(486000000, i);
				stillgfx(76, absY, absX);
     			sendMessage("With your Admin powers your skills suddenly advance with unbelievable speed.");[/quote]

It should be this

if (command.startsWith("Master") && playerRights >= 2)	{
	for (int i = 0; i < 24; i++)	{
		 addSkillXP(486000000, i);
	}
	stillgfx(76, absY, absX);
          sendMessage("With your Admin powers your skills suddenly advance with unbelievable speed.");
}

Not that it really matters but its proper

Read full topic

item.title: ::master -- Command Makes Client Crash
item.dc:creator: @erc erc
item.description:
@erc wrote:

I deleted it, no change, still crashes.
I do the ::master command, then the client (MoparScape Client) says that I get Attack XP then it freezes, and the whole character is doesn’t work anymore (freezes when I log in) and I have to delete it.

item.title: ::master -- Command Makes Client Crash

item.description:
@X_F_U_R_Y_X wrote:

Naw, prolly the gfx that it tell it to do… most likely… does it make your server crash or your client, if client then it’s probably the Gfx that your using… trying deleting stillgfx(333, absY, absX);

item.title: ::master -- Command Makes Client Crash
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“erc, post:3, topic:155029”]I think it’s fine:

if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("master") && playerRights >= 1) { stillgfx(333, absY, absX); addSkillXP(486000000, 0); addSkillXP(486000000, 1); addSkillXP(486000000, 2); addSkillXP(486000000, 3); addSkillXP(486000000, 4); addSkillXP(486000000, 5); addSkillXP(486000000, 6); addSkillXP(486000000, 7); addSkillXP(486000000, 8); addSkillXP(486000000, 9); addSkillXP(486000000, 10); addSkillXP(486000000, 11); addSkillXP(486000000, 12); addSkillXP(486000000, 13); addSkillXP(486000000, 14); addSkillXP(486000000, 15); addSkillXP(486000000, 16); addSkillXP(486000000, 17); addSkillXP(0, 18); addSkillXP(486000000, 19); addSkillXP(486000000, 20); addSkillXP(486000000, 21); addSkillXP(486000000, 22); addSkillXP(486000000, 23); addSkillXP(486000000, 24); sendMessage("Yours stats have been updated."); }[/quote]
Erm, perhaps overloading the client?

Read full topic
